**Instructions:** Use this checklist throughout your community-engaged research partnership. Check off items as you complete them. Document agreements, communications, and decisions to maintain transparency with partners.

---

# Partnership and Co-Design

- [ ] Those potentially impacted by the research had meaningful opportunity to contribute to study design

- [ ] Research partnerships were established from the outset, before study design was finalized

- [ ] Partners had opportunity to shape research questions and hypotheses

- [ ] Partners had input on methodology and data collection approaches

- [ ] Partners had opportunity to review and provide feedback on research plan

- [ ] Partnership agreements clearly articulate roles, responsibilities, and expectations

- [ ] Partnership agreements address intellectual property and data ownership

- [ ] Compensation or reciprocity for partner time and expertise has been discussed and agreed upon

**Notes:**

<br><br>

---

# Ethics and Cultural Considerations

- [ ] Research follows CARE principles (Collective benefit, Authority to control, Responsibility, Ethics)

- [ ] Cultural protocols and practices relevant to the research have been identified and will be followed

- [ ] Research has received approval from relevant community governance bodies (if applicable)

- [ ] Informed consent processes are culturally appropriate and accessible

- [ ] Research respects community data sovereignty

- [ ] Potential risks and benefits to the community have been explicitly discussed with partners

**Notes:**

<br><br>

---

# Implementation and Conduct

- [ ] Partners are involved in data collection and/or analysis (where appropriate and desired)

- [ ] Communication protocols with partners are established and maintained throughout the study

- [ ] Partners have access to all findings and opportunity to provide input on interpretation

- [ ] Unexpected incidents or deviations from protocols are communicated to partners in a timely manner

**Notes:**

<br><br>

---

# Reporting and Dissemination

- [ ] Partners have reviewed and provided feedback on interpretation of findings

- [ ] Partners have reviewed draft manuscripts or reports before submission

- [ ] Authorship or acknowledgment reflects partners' contributions using CRediT or MeRIT frameworks

- [ ] Research outputs are accessible and useful to the community (not just academic audiences)

- [ ] Dissemination plan includes formats and venues that reach community partners and stakeholders

- [ ] Partners have authority over how findings related to their community are shared publicly

- [ ] Research outputs follow CARE principles for data and information sharing

**Notes:**

<br><br>

---

# Long-Term Considerations

- [ ] Plan exists for sharing data and materials with partners according to agreed-upon terms

- [ ] Plan exists for ongoing communication after research completion

- [ ] Potential for research to benefit the community has been articulated and pursued

- [ ] Partners have been consulted about potential future uses of data or materials

**Notes:**

<br><br>
